translation.en: [narrator] You might be warm in bed tonight, but look at these places.
translation.ko: 포근한 잠자리에 들 여러분 여기를 한번 보시죠

translation.en: Welcome to 72 of the world's most dangerous places to live.
translation.ko: '세상에서 제일 살기 위험한 72곳'에 오신 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: Some people choose to live here.
But would you even dare to visit?
In fact, thousands of tourists flock to dangerous destinations every year.
translation.ko: 사실 매년 수천 명의 관광객이 위험지역을 방문합니다

translation.en: Some are on extreme journeys in pursuit of an authentic experience,
translation.ko: 누군가는 생생한 체험을 위해 위험한 여정에 올라

translation.en: ticking the adventure tourism box.
They're remote, hard to get to, and a risk you may never forget.
translation.ko: 접근하기 힘든 외진 곳에서 잊지 못할 위험도 겪습니다

translation.en: These are places that may feel unnerving, unbelievable.
translation.ko: 이 지역들은 상상도 못 할 정도로 불안합니다

translation.en: They may trap your attention or be seemingly harmless,
but the time bomb is ticking, ready to take you by surprise.
translation.ko: 언제 시한폭탄처럼 여러분을 놀라게 할지 모릅니다

translation.en: 72 Dangerous Places to Live.
Some call it home sweet home, others know looks can be deceiving.
translation.ko: 누군가에게는 정겨운 고향이지만 보이는 게 다는 아닙니다

translation.en: First up is a town that destroyed itself but no one wanted to leave.
translation.ko: 먼저 볼 곳은 붕괴한 마을입니다 하지만 주민들은 남고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: What does it take for a town to lose its zip code?
translation.ko: 그런데 어쩌다가 모두 떠나 버린 걸까요?

translation.en: When life as you know it is turned upside down...
When the town you call home becomes a hot spot,
it usually means a population increase.
translation.ko: 일반적으로 핫 스팟은 인구 증가를 뜻합니다

translation.en: But if the hotspot is caused by an underground coal fire
it's literally too hot to handle.
What I discovered was very fascinating.
translation.ko: 아주 흥미로운 걸 발견했어요 "티키 트렉스, 도시 탐험가"

translation.en: I couldn't wrap my head around the fact that coal could burn so long underground,
translation.ko: 지하에서 석탄불이 그렇게 오래 탈 수 있다니 이해가 안 됐죠

translation.en: causing the evacuation of a town.
translation.ko: 그것 때문에 주민들은 대피를 해야 했어요

translation.en: [narrator] Since 1962 the then residents of Centralia,
a small town in the northeastern mountains of Pennsylvania,
translation.ko: 펜실베이니아 산맥 북동쪽에 위치한 작은 마을의 주민들은

translation.en: have been trying to come to terms with just this...
How a small fire that appears to have started in a garbage dump,
translation.ko: 어떻게 쓰레기 처리장에서 시작된 작은 불씨 때문에

translation.en: could cause so much damage?
The coal that once sustained the town was on track to destroy it.
translation.ko: 땅 밑에 묻혀 있던 석탄이 마을을 파괴하기 시작했기 때문이죠

translation.en: At a hundred meters the temperature of the fire is about 600-650 Celsius.
translation.ko: 지하 100m 아래 온도는 섭씨 600에서 650도 정도 되고

translation.en: At a third of a meter the temperature has been measured at 440 Celsius.
[narrator] Tiki Trex is an urban explorer
who fuels her popular YouTube channel with abandoned places.
translation.ko: 유튜브에 버려진 지역을 소개해 인기를 얻고 있습니다

translation.en: At Centralia, she discovered an ongoing catastrophe.
[Trex] I put a meat thermometer in the ground here.
It feels a lot hotter.
Yeah, this one's a little hotter at...
Okay, it's climbing still.
One fifty-three, 154...
I don't wanna put my camera too close so the lens will fog up
translation.ko: 렌즈에 김이 서릴까 봐 카메라는 가까이 대지 않을게요

translation.en: and my hand is actually burning right now.
One fifty-five...
And in Celsius, it's 68.
[narrator] Noxious gases emanate from the fire,
but still the town became divided about whether to stay or leave.
translation.ko: 마을을 떠날지 말지 주민들은 의견이 분분했습니다

translation.en: In 2013, six people won the battle
to remain in Centralia for the rest of their lives.
Everyone else left voluntarily or have faced eviction.
As the people moved on, their homes were flattened
and nature has taken control of the land where they once lived
translation.ko: 한때 사람들이 살았던 이곳은 자연의 지배를 받게 됐습니다

translation.en: leaving a grid of streets seemingly going nowhere.
translation.ko: 이 길의 끝이 어딘지 언뜻 봐선 알 수가 없습니다 "전, 후"

translation.en: I would describe it as a ghost town,
based on the feeling I had walking the tree-lined streets,
translation.ko: 나무가 길게 늘어선 거리를 걸을 때 그랬죠

translation.en: and the remnants of a once-thriving mining town still remain
translation.ko: 그리고 비록 건물 대부분이 무너지긴 했어도

translation.en: even though most structures have been razed.
translation.ko: 한때 번성했던 광산 마을의 모습이 남아 있긴 했어요

translation.en: [narrator] The underground fire, covering an area of roughly 400 surface acres, is growing.
translation.ko: 약 1.6제곱킬로미터 대지 밑에서 석탄불이 점점 커지고 있습니다

translation.en: It has been burning for more than 50 years
and is expected to continue for at least another 200.
Smoke continually swirls from the surface fractures
translation.ko: 지표면의 갈라진 틈에서는 연기가 끝없이 나오고

translation.en: and Route 61, once leading to Centralia, is permanently diverted.
translation.ko: 한때 센트렐리아로 이어졌던 61번 도로는 영구히 폐쇄됐습니다

translation.en: The road continues to crack under the heat and is dangerously unstable.
translation.ko: 석탄불로 도로가 무너지고 있어 굉장히 불안정한 상태죠

translation.en: It may be deserted of cars
but this graffiti highway is full of messages of peace,
destruction and tourists' monikers.
translation.ko: 마을 붕괴와 관련한 낙서나 관광객들 흔적이 가득합니다

translation.en: Despite the dangers, many come to explore,
translation.ko: 위험에도 불구하고 이곳을 찾는 사람이 많은데

translation.en: to try to make sense of what's been left behind.
During my exploration of Centralia, I was able to locate a time capsule
and it was originally sealed in 1866 by the past residents.
And it is scheduled to be unsealed in 2016
for Centralia's 150th year anniversary.
Apparently, many are looking forward to its opening
and they are gonna have a reunion along with it.
translation.ko: 타임캡슐 때문에 주민들이 다시 모일 거예요

translation.en: [narrator] Each danger zone featured in 72 Dangerous Places
translation.ko: '72곳의 위험한 지역들'에 등장하는 등장하는 모든 위험 지역은

translation.en: will be ranked according to lifestyle, potential threat,
translation.ko: 생활 방식, 잠재적 위험과 어떤 도움이 필요하고

translation.en: what help is available and whether you will survive.
translation.ko: 생존이 가능한지 여부에 따라 순위가 매겨질 겁니다

translation.en: Survival and fear are different for everyone.
Will your top ten dangerous places match ours?
translation.ko: 여러분이 뽑은 위험한 곳 상위 10위가 이 프로그램과 일치하나요?

translation.en: Centralia in Pennsylvania started the show ranked at number 31,
but coming in at number 20 is a playground where rescuers are waiting for disaster.
translation.ko: 하지만 지금 소개할 20위는 사고 구조대가 있는 행락지입니다

translation.en: When you least expect it, and there's nowhere to run... [man] Whoa.
translation.ko: 예상하지 못한 때 도망갈 곳도 없이

translation.en: ...you're at the mercy of the mountain.
Yeah, a few that have shaken me up.
Dealing with those stressful incidents is hard, for sure.
translation.ko: 그런 위험한 상황을 만나면 물론 힘들죠 "제프 셰르스토비토프 눈사태 전문가, 순찰대"

translation.en: [narrator] The Rocky Mountains dwarf the landscapes of Western North America.
translation.ko: 로키산맥 때문에 북미 서부 지역이 작아 보입니다

translation.en: The scale of this mountain range is immense.
Covering an area of one million square kilometers
and rising to 4,500 meters,
it is one of the world's great natural wonders.
It's just one of many rugged mountain ranges
that dominate peoples' lives in North America,
translation.ko: 북미 사람들의 삶에 큰 영향을 줍니다

translation.en: especially for the residents of Canada.
But with this alpine lifestyle comes many dangers.
translation.ko: 높은 산이 주변에 있으면 위험한 일이 많이 생기기도 합니다

translation.en: But the one mountain activity that causes twice as many injuries
as the most notorious winter blood sport of ice hockey,
translation.ko: 아이스하키보다 2배나 사고가 잦은 산악 스포츠가 있는데

translation.en: is the family friendly snow sports, skiing and snowboarding.
translation.ko: 가족 단위로 즐기는 겨울 스포츠인 스키와 스노보드입니다

translation.en: So this challenges even one of the most professionally run ski resorts
translation.ko: 스키 전문 리조트 역시 이 때문에 어려움을 겪는데

translation.en: that sits on the western edge of the Canadian Rockies,
Big White, British Columbia.
translation.ko: 브리티시 컬럼비아 주의 빅 화이트 리조트입니다

translation.en: Ski Patrol Operations manager Kris Hawryluik
has been conducting rescues at Big White for over 20 years.
translation.ko: 20년 넘게 빅 화이트에서 구조 활동을 해 왔습니다

translation.en: And to say he and his team are kept busy doesn't really do them justice.
translation.ko: 발 빠른 구조 업무에도 불구하고 제대로 된 보상도 받지 못하죠

translation.en: [Hawryluik] Here at Big White we got a pretty tough job to do.
translation.ko: 이곳 빅 화이트에서 저희는 어려운 임무를 맡았어요

translation.en: We have 600,000 skier visits, 119 ski runs,
translation.ko: 60만 명이 방문하고 코스는 119개나 있죠 "크리스 하루락, 스키 순찰 대장"

translation.en: 11 square kilometers of skiable terrain that we have to manage
every single day, seven days a week.
We do approximately 1,200 to 1,300 accident response each season
and they range anything from simple knee sprains
to fatalities out on the hill.
[narrator] Avalanche forecaster and ski patroller Doug Lundgren
translation.ko: 눈사태 예보 전문가이자 스키 순찰대인 더그 런더그랜은

translation.en: was a pioneer of the snowboarding world, so he's seen it all on the ski slopes.
translation.ko: 스노보딩 계의 선구자로 온갖 스키 코스를 봐 왔습니다

translation.en: I was working in the heli-ski industry and cat skiing,
translation.ko: 헬리 스키, 캣 스키 쪽에서 일했어요

translation.en: so pretty much my whole life dealing with avalanches and blowing things up.
translation.ko: "더그 런더그랜 눈사태 예보 전문가" 그렇다 보니 평생 눈사태나 눈보라를 보고 살았죠

translation.en: Just as the sport has progressed
into steeper terrain and the more kind of extreme skiing,
translation.ko: 가파른 코스나 과격한 형태로 즐기는 방향으로 가다 보니

translation.en: you know, we need to control those areas and make sure they're safe.
translation.ko: 저희도 그런 코스를 관리해서 안전히 스키를 즐길 수 있게 하죠

translation.en: You can get in--
You can get in some pretty hairy situations.
translation.ko: 꽤 심각한 상황을 만날 때도 있어요

translation.en: [narrator] The common misunderstanding is that avalanches are only a danger
translation.ko: 익스트림 스포츠를 즐기는 사람만 눈사태를 만날 거로 보통 생각하는데

translation.en: to the more extreme sports lovers, and that's a massive mistake.
translation.ko: 그건 아주 크게 잘못 생각하는 겁니다

translation.en: With the right weather conditions and terrain, the mix is deadly to anyone
translation.ko: 눈사태 발생에 적합한 기후 조건과 지형이 만나면

translation.en: who happens to be caught in the wrong place at the wrong time.
translation.ko: 그 일대에 있는 누구나 위험할 수 있습니다

translation.en: -[man 1] Wow. -[man 2] Awesome.
[narrator] The majority of avalanches do not occur in the super steep slopes,
translation.ko: 대부분 눈사태는 매우 가파른 데가 아니라

translation.en: but in terrain between 34 to 45 degrees.
If you were thinking that you could outrun an avalanche
translation.ko: 혹시 눈사태에서 도망칠 수 있다고 생각한다면

translation.en: you are mad,
as the terminal velocity of the slide is faster than a car on a freeway.
And once it hits you, it sets like concrete,
making it almost impossible to dig your way out.
translation.ko: 눈을 헤치고 나오는 게 거의 불가능합니다

translation.en: [man] Help!
Help!
I'm stuck!
[narrator] The consequences of being hit by an avalanche
are demonstrated clearly in this avalanche drill
conducted by Big White's Ski Patrol.
If you are unlucky enough to be buried in a real avalanche,
you will have a good chance of survival if rescued in 15 minutes.
After that, it quickly becomes a body recovery program.
Each year in British Columbia, Canada,
there are an average of ten avalanche deaths,
and a staggering 150 fatalities worldwide.
So this is why mountain resorts place such an emphasis
on avalanche control and rescue training.
translation.ko: 눈사태 방지와 구조 활동을 강조하는 이유입니다

translation.en: It really is a matter of life and death.
But rest assured that ski patrollers around the world
are attempting to make your time in the ski fields safer.
translation.ko: 고객이 안전하게 스키를 즐기도록 하는 것입니다

translation.en: For without them this would be a deadly hobby.
translation.ko: 순찰대가 없었다면 목숨을 건 취미가 될 뻔했습니다

translation.en: But there certainly is an upside to life as a patroller.
The snow, man. [chuckling] This is the best job in the world!
translation.ko: 눈을 보잖아요 세상에 둘도 없는 직업이죠

translation.en: [narrator] From the risks of mountain life to a Pacific island hideaway,
translation.ko: 이제 위험한 산악 지대에서 태평양의 외딴 섬으로 가겠습니다

translation.en: where seclusion can be the biggest risk to life...
[narrator] Tall tales and high seas, mystery and mutiny,
translation.ko: 믿기 어려운 이야기와 높은 파도 미스터리와 반란

translation.en: swashbuckling adventures...
Over 200 years of storytelling has certainly placed
the incredibly remote destination of Pitcairn Island on the world map.
translation.ko: 세계 지도 위 외딴 섬인 피트케언 섬을 배경입니다

translation.en: Although the name of this island may be little known
translation.ko: 이름이 낯설 수도 있는 이 섬은

translation.en: until it's linked with the infamous words, Mutiny on the Bounty,
translation.ko: 악명 높은 '바운티호의 반란'과 관련이 있는 곳으로

translation.en: then its history is rich and turbulent.
Roughly 300 nautical miles from any other inhabited island,
translation.ko: 다른 섬에서 300해리 정도 떨어진 피트케언 섬은

translation.en: Pitcairn is a volcanic speck in the middle of the southern Pacific Ocean
at only a mile wide and two miles long.
To get to Pitcairn Island you first need to fly to Tahiti,
translation.ko: 피트케언에 가려면 우선 비행기로 타히티로 가서

translation.en: then catch a local flight to nearby Mangareva.
translation.ko: 거기서 국내선을 타고 망가레바 인근으로 가야 합니다

translation.en: From Mangareva it's time to board a cargo vessel
for what is often a rough three days at sea to Pitcairn.
translation.ko: 사흘 정도 가면 피트케언 섬에 도착합니다

translation.en: This island tops the list for isolated spots.
translation.ko: 이 섬은 고립 지역 중에서도 가장 외진 곳에 속합니다

translation.en: There is a doctor in residence,
but if you need major medical attention you may not make it.
translation.ko: 심각한 치료가 필요할 경우 목숨을 잃을 수도 있습니다

translation.en: Pitcairn Island was founded in 1790 by people who sought this isolation.
translation.ko: 섬은 피트케언을 찾아 나선 사람들이 1790년에 처음 발견했습니다

translation.en: Today there are only about 50 inhabitants,
descended mostly from those who arrived aboard the Bounty.
translation.ko: 대부분 바운티호를 타고 온 사람들의 후손입니다

translation.en: Their supplies are delivered by sea
every couple of months from nearby Mangareva.
A return journey that takes about six days,
a cruise that intrepid travelers are welcome to join.
So if you're up for a seafaring adventure
to one of the most isolated islands in the world
translation.ko: 세계에서 가장 외진 섬으로 모험을 떠나고 싶다면

translation.en: then Pitcairn will definitely tick the box.
However, if the isolation,
the chance of rough, wild weather, landslides and mosquitoes,
coupled with the fact you're not allowed on the island
without medical insurance that includes evacuation cover,
aren't key on your ideal holiday,
then maybe this is a spot that will be high on your dangerous list.
Isolated, but clearly a pristine environment to live.
translation.ko: 하지만 고립되긴 해도 생존에 필요한 여건은 갖췄죠

translation.en: However, up next is a place where every breath you take is a gamble.
translation.ko: 그러나 다음에 소개할 곳에선 목숨 걸고 숨을 쉬어야 합니다

translation.en: Pollution.
[man] You couldn't see anything.
You could see the nearest building, that was about it.
translation.ko: 가장 가까운 건물이나 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: [narrator] The air could literally kill you.
When we first got there, the first week,
translation.ko: 처음 거기 갔을 때, 첫 주에

translation.en: the pollution was bad, really bad.
translation.ko: "앤드루 스피틀, 스포츠 카메라맨" 공기가 매우 나빴어요

translation.en: [narrator] If you live in places like China, you're one of the worst affected.
translation.ko: 중국 같은 곳에서 산다면 공해에 제일 많이 노출된 것입니다

translation.en: [Spittle] I was in Beijing for the 2008 Olympics.
There was a lot of concern about traffic and the pollution was terrible.
translation.ko: 교통 문제로 걱정이 많았고 대기오염이 정말 심각했어요

translation.en: So we were really concerned about how that was gonna affect our health.
translation.ko: 건강에 어떤 영향을 끼칠지 많이 걱정했었죠

translation.en: [narrator] The World Health Organization believes
that few risks have greater impact on global health than air pollution.
translation.ko: 대기오염이 공중 보건에 큰 영향을 준다고 믿습니다

translation.en: In the space of one year, millions of people will die worldwide,
translation.ko: 1년 동안 전 세계에서 몇백만 명이 목숨을 잃을 텐데

translation.en: many of those in Beijing.
Beijing is one of the most polluted cities in the world
translation.ko: 베이징은 대기오염이 세계에서 제일 심한 도시로

translation.en: with records reaching 40 times higher than the recommended safety levels.
Power and transport, comforts that we take for granted,
translation.ko: 당연시하며 사용했던 에너지나 운송 수단의 안락함 때문에

translation.en: are now responsible for contributing to the vast amounts of toxins
translation.ko: 막대한 양의 독성 물질이 배출되고 있고

translation.en: that weigh heavy on the city.
When you consider that 70 percent of China's energy
comes from coal-fired power stations
and that China is the number one car producer in the world,
translation.ko: 중국이 세계 최대의 자동차 생산국인 걸 생각하면

translation.en: it's no wonder the amount of pollution produced can truly take your breath away.
translation.ko: 대기오염으로 목숨을 잃는 건 놀랄 일도 아닙니다

translation.en: [woman] The air is not so good, especially around noontime.
translation.ko: 공기가 정오 무렵에 특히 안 좋아요

translation.en: Then my throat is not very comfortable.
[narrator] Beijing is just one city in a large region
that cops extreme, persistent air pollution.
translation.ko: 넓은 지역에서 계속 극심한 대기오염을 겪습니다

translation.en: It is surrounded by Hebei Province, a region known for its steel production
translation.ko: 철강 생산으로 알려진 허베이 성이 주변에 있는데

translation.en: and home to seven of China's most polluted cities.
translation.ko: 중국에서 제일 오염이 심한 도시가 이 지역에 7곳이나 있습니다

translation.en: It only takes one day of wind from the southwest
to shroud the capital in severe smog.
Those living within the city
will experience health issues that can impact them for life.
translation.ko: 건강 이상으로 평생 고생할 수도 있습니다

translation.en: Heart disease, cancer, strokes
and respiratory illnesses are all a threat.
The pollution was an everyday hazard you had to sort of deal with.
[narrator] Checking the pollution is a daily task, just like most people check the weather.
translation.ko: 마치 날씨를 확인하듯 오염도를 확인하는 게 일과입니다

translation.en: There are days when the air quality rating is so high,
people are told to stay indoors, not to leave their houses,
resist driving and take other self-protection measures.
translation.ko: 운전을 삼가며 피할 방법을 스스로 찾아야 합니다

translation.en: A lot of people walk around with masks on.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 마스크를 사용해요 사람들이 왜 마스크를 쓰는지 의아하게 생각할 수 있지만

translation.en: You think, why are people walking around with masks on,
translation.ko: 사람들이 왜 마스크를 쓰는지 의아하게 생각할 수 있지만

translation.en: but it becomes very clear very quickly that it's a health reason.
translation.ko: 건강 때문이란 것을 재빨리 알게 되죠

translation.en: You're gonna breathe in toxic fumes.
translation.ko: 독성 물질 속에서 숨을 쉬어야 하니까요

translation.en: I think it's necessary.
I'm not sure if a mask can stop everything but better to wear it on.
translation.ko: 마스크가 다 막지는 못해도 쓰는 게 낫죠

translation.en: [woman] This mask is quite popular in China
because particles is the main problem in Beijing,
translation.ko: 베이징에서는 미세 먼지가 가장 큰 문제라서

translation.en: so we sell this very, very well.
[narrator] The most damaging particles known as particulate matter
translation.ko: 가장 문제가 되는 건 미세 먼지로

translation.en: are those so small you cannot see with the naked eye.
translation.ko: 매우 크기가 작아 육안으로는 볼 수 없습니다

translation.en: They will penetrate and lodge deep within the lungs.
translation.ko: 미세 먼지는 폐에 깊이 박히게 됩니다

translation.en: PM2.5 and PM10 are two types of particulate matter
that are significantly monitored, and are the most serious in Beijing.
translation.ko: 주요 관찰 대상이며 베이징에서 가장 심하게 나타납니다

translation.en: Beijing is actively implementing policies in transport, urban planning,
translation.ko: 베이징은 적극적으로 정책을 마련해 교통, 도시계획

translation.en: power generation and industry to reduce air pollution.
translation.ko: 발전소, 산업체가 원인인 대기오염을 줄이고자 합니다

translation.en: Priority is given to clean modes of power generation
with renewable combustion-free power sources.
translation.ko: 재생 가능한 무연소 에너지원을 이용하는 거죠

translation.en: [Spittle] I don't think I could live in China
knowing that everyday taking a breath was a risk to my health.
translation.ko: 매일 숨 쉬는 것 자체가 건강에 안 좋은 걸 아니까요

translation.en: Beijing is a great place to visit but a tough place to live.
translation.ko: 베이징은 여행지로는 좋지만 살기는 어려운 곳이에요

translation.en: [narrator] From smog-filled Beijing at number 25, we move to number two on the list,
where you'll need to swap your mask for a snorkel.
What would you do if your entire nation
translation.ko: 만약 나라 전체가 몇십 년 안에

translation.en: was going to disappear in a matter of decades?
If you lived on a low reef island in the Pacific,
I'd be really worried right now.
[narrator] As a warming climate drives sea levels higher,
the islands of Kiribati face a very uncertain future.
translation.ko: 키리바시 섬의 운명은 알 수 없게 됐습니다

translation.en: Kiribati is a beautiful islands,
but very vulnerable, very low lying and therefore highly vulnerable
to the impact particularly of climate change, particularly of sea level rise.
translation.ko: 특히 기후 변화나 해수면 상승의 영향을 많이 받아요

translation.en: And so our future days are numbered.
[narrator] On the 33 beautiful Pacific islands
some 100,000 people will be severely affected within the century,
translation.ko: 10만여 명은 한 세기 내로 엄청난 위험에 처하게 됩니다

translation.en: perhaps even before that.
How so? Well, they'll be underwater.
Passionate about climate change, Mick O'Leary can see a future of doom.
translation.ko: 기후변화에 관심 많은 믹 오리어리는 파멸을 보았습니다 "응용과학"

translation.en: Regions in the central, south, and north Pacific
are actually experiencing sea level rise anywhere
from six to eight, up to ten millimeters per year.
translation.ko: 매년 6mm에서 8mm 최대 10mm 상승해요 "믹 오리어리 박사 해양 지구 과학자, 커틴 대학교"

translation.en: Times that by 100 years and there's one meter of sea level rise.
Already we are feeling the impacts
and I can guarantee you that within a shorter period of time
translation.ko: "아노테 통 키리바시 대통령" 분명한 건 보다 이른 시일 내에

translation.en: we will see total massive destruction to our lifestyle.
translation.ko: 우리의 삶이 파괴되는 걸 직접 보게 될 거예요

translation.en: [narrator] President Anote Tong has been an avid leader
for climate change awareness and action for many years,
translation.ko: 오랫동안 기후 변화를 인지하고 행동을 취했습니다

translation.en: being one of the first to feel its effects.
translation.ko: 위험을 가장 먼저 감지한 사람 중 하나였죠

translation.en: In 2014, Greenpeace took the president to see first hand
the source of rising sea levels and the effect it has on the rest of the world
translation.ko: 지구 전체에 미치는 영향을 직접 보도록 했습니다

translation.en: and how it will destroy his country.
Climate change is indeed a global process.
What we are seeing is massive sheets of ice.
translation.ko: 우리가 보고 있는 것은 거대한 얼음 조각이에요

translation.en: And if, as I'm being told, much of this ice has already melted away.
translation.ko: 내가 들은 바로는 이 조각이 이미 녹고 있다고 해요

translation.en: But if what remains will continue to melt,
translation.ko: 하지만 남은 얼음이 마저 녹게 된다면

translation.en: then obviously this will also accelerate the demise of our countries.
[narrator] Kiribati has an average height of two meters above sea level,
making it one of the most vulnerable countries to rising sea levels.
translation.ko: 그것 때문에 세계에서 해수면 상승에 제일 취약합니다

translation.en: We are experiencing the impacts right now,
and those who are not feeling the impact should not believe that it's not happening
translation.ko: 겪지 못했다고 해서 괜찮다고 생각해서 안 돼요

translation.en: because they're not feeling it or they're not seeing it.
translation.ko: 위험이 눈에 보이거나 느낄 수 있는 게 아니거든요

translation.en: I invite people who feel like that to come and visit our islands
and they can see for themselves what is happening there.
[narrator] President Anote Tong has been buying land in Fiji,
translation.ko: 아노테 통 대통령은 피지의 섬을 사들였습니다

translation.en: preparing his people for one bold exit strategy.
translation.ko: 국민이 대피할 수 있도록 대담한 전략을 취한 것입니다

translation.en: The islands are so important to our people.
They say land is life to us.
You are attached to the land that belongs to your people.
translation.ko: 우리가 사는 이 섬에 우린 속해 있어요

translation.en: You know, your fathers and forefathers. And on that land you build your house.
translation.ko: 우리의 아버지와 선조들의 땅에 집을 지었는데

translation.en: On that land you have your water.
Everything that is you and is Kiribati, is on that land.
translation.ko: 땅 위의 모든 게 우리이고 키리바시는 이 땅 자체예요

translation.en: If they take away this land, people then have to move, hmm?
Where will they move to?
How can I become a Kiribati somewhere else,
translation.ko: 다른 곳에서 어떻게 키리바시 사람이 되고

translation.en: on another man's land, and still be proud as a Kiribati person?
translation.ko: 어떻게 다른 사람 땅에서 자랑스러운 키리바시 사람으로

translation.en: How can I?
[narrator] If there's one thing that's certain, it is that Kiribati's days are numbered,
translation.ko: 하나 분명한 건 키리바시의 미래는 며칠 안 남았고

translation.en: and it really is a global situation.
You might be safe in your bed tonight, but try not to get too comfortable.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤은 침대에서 안전하겠지만 안전에 너무 익숙해지지 마세요

translation.en: What they must understand is our world is being threatened.
translation.ko: 지구가 위험에 처한 걸 알아야 해요

translation.en: We are the first on the front line, but they will be the next.
translation.ko: 우리가 먼저 그 위험을 겪지만 다음은 여러분 차례라는 거죠

translation.en: Those next on the front line.
And in time, those who do not believe they're being threatened now
will be threatened if nothing is done.
[narrator] If you are looking for real estate,
then these islands should be at the bottom of your list,
but don't be so quick to dismiss it as a tropical island getaway.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 열대의 섬을 제외하라는 것은 아닙니다

translation.en: Kiribati is desperate to save its homeland
translation.ko: 키리바시는 최선을 다해 섬을 지키고 있지만

translation.en: but global warming is just one of the dangers for our planet.
translation.ko: 지구 온난화는 지구를 위협하는 위험의 하나입니다

translation.en: Enter Nepal.
They were spiritually high, a sacred valley near the Tibetan border.
translation.ko: 티베트 국경 부근에는 영적으로 신성한 지역이 있습니다

translation.en: Descending, drinking in the wonder and majesty,
when the gods delivered a rumbling message.
It's exactly how you think it feels, really,
like the ground starts waving.
[narrator] The people that live here have a raw connection with nature,
translation.ko: 이곳 사람들은 자연과 지독한 관계를 맺고 있는데

translation.en: a connection that this group of holiday trekkers also now knows too well.
translation.ko: 휴가차 온 도보 여행객들도 이젠 그 관계를 알게 됐습니다

translation.en: This is Nepal.
There's a lot of noise happening.
There is such power all around you.
[narrator] Surrounded by some of the planet's most heavenly, dramatic mountainscape,
translation.ko: 지구에서 가장 천국에 가까운 황홀한 산세에 둘러싸인

translation.en: Nepal's beauty rests on a precarious foundation.
When the earth underneath you twists this way and that
and decades of strain become too much to bear,
translation.ko: 수십 년의 압력이 더는 버틸 수 없게 되자

translation.en: the ground beneath your feet starts splitting
and the mountains come rushing towards you.
You take for granted that the earth that you're standing on is gonna be there.
translation.ko: 우리가 서 있는 이 지구가 계속 그 자리에 있을 거라 믿죠

translation.en: [narrator] Curious mountain explorer Claire Vanderplank was in Nepal
translation.ko: 호기심 많은 산악 탐험가 클레어 밴더플랑크는

translation.en: when the largest earthquake in over 80 years
translation.ko: 80년 만의 대지진이 네팔을 덮쳤을 때 네팔에 있었는데

translation.en: left much of the country looking like a bed of sticks and stones.
translation.ko: 그 지진으로 네팔은 잔해와 돌무더기로 뒤덮였습니다

translation.en: I think the biggest shock is watching what happens on the mountains.
translation.ko: 산이 어떻게 됐는지 봤는데 그게 제일 충격이었어요

translation.en: There was a lot of destruction on the path
and people were killed further down from landslides and avalanches.
[narrator] Rocks shook from the walls of hand-built homes
translation.ko: 바위는 손으로 지은 집 벽을 흔들어 댔고

translation.en: and as they watched, villages slowly folded and disappeared.
translation.ko: 마을은 천천히 접힌 뒤 사라져 버렸습니다

translation.en: [Vanderplank] Like I remember seeing one village
translation.ko: 제가 봤던 것 중 기억에 남는 게

translation.en: which was pretty much built like, on top of a ridge.
It must have just been shaking everywhere and the whole--
All of the houses were just decimated.
[narrator] This is the village where Claire and her friends
were supposed to be staying overnight.
We finally got a helicopter out,
looking at some of the villages that we walked through
and you just see landslides that were as big as the village,
like either right next to it or partially over it.
translation.ko: 바로 옆에서 나거나 부분적으로 끝난 상태 같았죠

translation.en: From the air was where you saw how, you know, some villages
were completely wiped out.
Further down you could see just massive boulders,
like five times the size of the houses.
[narrator] From Mt. Everest through the valleys, to the capital Kathmandu,
this intoxicating, spiritual land had been shaken to the core
all over again.
Earthquakes are frequent in Nepal
with past records showing an average of two every 40 years,
ranging from seven and a half to eight on the Richter scale.
translation.ko: 리히터 측정계로 재면 진도 7.5에서 8 정도의 지진이죠

translation.en: Escalating population, coupled with poor construction practices,
translation.ko: 건설 기술은 뒤떨어지는 상황에서 인구가 증가하다 보니

translation.en: only add to Nepal's vulnerability to earthquakes.
Further still, much of Nepal suffers from a phenomenon known as liquefaction.
translation.ko: 더불어 네팔은 액상화 현상까지 겪고 있습니다

translation.en: The Kathmandu Valley sits on an ancient lake
and the soil underneath it is filled with soft sediments
translation.ko: 그 밑에는 부드러운 침전물이 가득 차 있어

translation.en: that magnify the impact of the earthquakes.
At this time the sediment turns from solid to semi-liquid,
translation.ko: 이번 지진 때는 침전물이 거의 액체가 돼

translation.en: losing its ability to support the structures above.
translation.ko: 땅 위 건축물들을 지탱할 수 없게 된 것이죠

translation.en: [Vanderplank] Probably the most heartbreaking thing to see
was the desperation that set in,
where in that situation so many people just didn't have a life there anymore.
There's a lot more impact in a place
where people don't have much of a buffer against such things happening.
translation.ko: 완충 장치가 없으면 영향을 더 받기 마련이죠

translation.en: [narrator] Wedged between China and India, Nepal lies on a "thrust fault"
translation.ko: 중국과 인도 사이에 있는 네팔은 충상단층입니다

translation.en: where the massive Indian and Eurasian plates
are constantly butting heads, pushing over on top of one another.
This movement built the Himalayas more than 40 million years ago
translation.ko: 4,000만 년 전 이 같은 충돌로 히말라야가 생겼는데

translation.en: and pushes them about one centimeter higher every year.
This is making the Kathmandu Valley
one of the most seismically hazardous regions in the world.
translation.ko: 세계에서 지진에 가장 취약한 지역이 됐습니다

translation.en: Larger quakes with a magnitude greater than eight
are expected to send heavily loaded jolts through the earth every 80 years.
[man] It's coming from there.
[narrator] It's hard to resist the seduction of Nepal:
the mountains, the spirituality, the tranquil beauty,
the kindness of the people.
It's a really beautiful place to be up in the Himalayas.
Yeah, it's a pretty magical place.
[narrator] But sometimes, making the most of nature comes with a high price.
Yeah, I think there'll still be a lot of work to do in the coming years.
translation.ko: 앞으로 해야 할 일이 많을 거예요

translation.en: But generally, you know, people are still going about their business
'cause they have to.
[narrator] In the face of danger,
so many communities work tirelessly to move forward
but when spirituality reigns, danger is often overlooked.
translation.ko: 신비한 분위기에 사로잡혀 위험이 오는 걸 모를 수 있습니다

translation.en: This is one of the greatest rivers in the world,
sacred to a billion Hindus worldwide.
translation.ko: 전 세계 10억 힌두교 신자가 신성하게 여기는 곳이죠

translation.en: A river so holy you would expect its waters to be pristine,
translation.ko: 신성한 강이다 보니 물이 깨끗할 거라고 기대합니다

translation.en: especially considering around eight percent of the world's population
live in its catchment area.
But pollution has turned the Ganges into a lethal cocktail
translation.ko: 하지만 갠지스 강은 산업 폐기물과 분뇨 때문에

translation.en: of industrial and human waste.
From the Himalayas to the Bay of Bengal,
the Ganges River passes through more than 100 towns and cities
translation.ko: 갠지스 강은 100개도 넘는 마을과 도시를 가로지릅니다

translation.en: absorbing all their human and industrial waste.
translation.ko: 그러면서 분뇨와 산업 폐기물을 흡수하게 되죠

translation.en: Millions of liters of untreated sewage from these towns
translation.ko: 이 마을들의 처리되지 않은 수백만 리터의 하수가

translation.en: is pumped into the river every day.
By the time it reaches Varanasi,
it becomes the sixth most polluted river in the world.
But this doesn't deter devoted Hindus from their daily dipping rituals.
translation.ko: 하지만 헌신적인 힌두교 신자들은 강에 몸 담그는 걸 멈추지 않습니다

translation.en: Every day pilgrims endure long, hard train journeys
translation.ko: 매일 순례자들은 길고 힘들게 기차를 타고 와

translation.en: to take a holy dip in its waters.
The Hindu belief is that if the dead are cremated
on the banks of the Ganges, and in Varanasi specifically,
translation.ko: 갠지스 강 둑에서 화장하면 특히 바라나시에서 하면

translation.en: that you will break the cycle of rebirth.
translation.ko: 환생의 고리를 끊을 수 있다고 믿습니다

translation.en: Every year around 200 tons of half-burnt human flesh
is sent down the river on its way to Nirvana.
Bathing here really is only for the strong-stomached
translation.ko: 이 강에 몸을 담그려면 비위가 아주 좋거나

translation.en: or those with blind faith.
But some locals dispute the seriousness of contamination claims.
translation.ko: 하지만 일부 주민은 오염의 심각성에 이의를 표합니다

translation.en: This is a fact that it is getting contaminated
but not that much that people are going to die while bathing here.
translation.ko: 하지만 물에 몸을 담근다고 죽을 만큼 오염된 건 아니에요

translation.en: If a river is totally contaminated
you won't see any kind of life in the water
but I have seen many fish in the river.
[narrator] In the United States, beaches are closed
if the fecal coliform count reaches 200 units per 100mL of water.
The Ganges River has over one million per 100mL of water,
making it a highway of viruses and bacteria.
If toxic water wasn't enough,
flash floods caused by glacial outbursts are another deadly threat
to those living in villages along the Ganges.
translation.ko: 갠지스 강 주변 마을에 또 다른 큰 위협입니다

translation.en: Rising temperatures are melting the Gangotri Glacier,
translation.ko: 기온이 상승하면서 히말라야에 있는 갠지스 강 수원인

translation.en: the source of the Ganges in the Himalayas.
Scientists say the glacier could disappear entirely by 2030.
translation.ko: 과학자들은 빙하가 2030년경 완전히 사라질 것으로 예측합니다

translation.en: If there is no glacier and the monsoon fails,
translation.ko: 만일 빙하가 없고 우기가 사라진다면 "믹 오리어리 박사 해양 지구 과학자, 커틴 대학교"

translation.en: then there's gonna be no water available for that river
and it will dry up.
For a religion whose culture is intimately linked with a river system,
translation.ko: 종교 문화가 강과 깊은 관계가 있다 보니

translation.en: that culture or that religion could be at threat through climate change.
translation.ko: 이 문화나 종교에 기후 변화는 위협이 되는 거죠

translation.en: [narrator] Undeterred, Hindus continue their daily rituals,
translation.ko: 저지하지 않는 한 힌두교 신자들은 계속해서 의식을 치를 것입니다

translation.en: believing their gods' power of keeping them safe
is much greater than the power of bacteria
translation.ko: 박테리아보다 강력하고 몸을 담그는 물이나 식수에 들은

translation.en: and other parasites they bathe in or drink.
translation.ko: 다른 기생충보다도 더 강하다고 믿으면서 말입니다

translation.en: The Ganges River is a spiritual, almost beyond earth experience
translation.ko: 갠지스 강은 신비롭고 상상 이상의 경험을 줍니다

translation.en: for the locals and the thousands that flock here daily,
translation.ko: 매일 강에 오는 수 천 명과 주민들에게 말이죠

translation.en: but to live on its banks can only be seen as dangerous.
translation.ko: 하지만 갠지스 강 둑에 사는 건 위험합니다

translation.en: Even if at sunrise it looks stunning.
From worshipping an abundance of water
to a place where water takes destruction to a new level,
a country where hardship is a way of life.
translation.ko: 이 나라는 고난이 생활 그 자체입니다

translation.en: There are some places in the world you wouldn't choose to go for a holiday
translation.ko: 휴가를 보내기 위해 피할 곳이 몇 곳 있습니다

translation.en: but some people have no choice.
translation.ko: 하지만 선택의 여지가 없는 사람도 있죠

translation.en: Where I'm standing here and behind me, this used to be a village.
translation.ko: 제가 서 있는 이곳과 뒤는 예전에 마을이었어요 "호러스 니아카 말라위 적십자 사회 자원 봉사자"

translation.en: Red Cross volunteers are telling us
that there were over 20 houses here that have been washed away.
translation.ko: 여기에 있었던 20가구가 모두 휩쓸려 갔다고 해요

translation.en: [narrator] If you think of Africa as endlessly hot, dry and dusty, think again.
translation.ko: 아프리카가 덥고 메마른 줄 안다면 다시 생각하세요

translation.en: In Malawi, widespread flooding in January 2015 left hundreds dead,
and nearly a quarter of a million running for their lives.
Crops were destroyed, livestock lost and homes abandoned.
After a month-long drought, rain was supposed to be a blessed relief.
But the torrential downpour and ruthless winds
that was Cyclone Bansi were relentless.
Heavy rains during the warm, wet season continuously trigger flash flooding
translation.ko: 온난 습윤 계절 동안 엄청난 양의 비가 쏟아지는데

translation.en: with over 95 percent of annual rain falling at this time.
translation.ko: 이때 비는 연 강수량의 95퍼센트로 돌발 홍수를 일으키죠

translation.en: But in this country it's a way of life.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 나라에선 그것이 생활의 일부입니다

translation.en: However, this way of life gets worse:
immense deforestation means no barriers to rapid floodwaters.
translation.ko: 막대한 양의 산림 벌채로 홍수를 막을 수 없게 되고

translation.en: Add a series of earthquakes to the list and those who live in Malawi
are constantly threatened by extremes that lead to homelessness,
translation.ko: 집을 잃게 됐고 기근과 질병에 시달리는 등

translation.en: famine and disease.
There are over 3,000 people at this camp.
Most of them have lost all their property that they had.
translation.ko: 여기 있는 많은 사람이 대부분의 재산을 잃었어요

translation.en: Now they need food, shelter and medical attention.
translation.ko: 지금 그분들에게 필요한 것은 식량, 쉼터, 치료입니다

translation.en: [narrator] Imagine your children were forced to hunt mice for food,
translation.ko: 아이들이 먹기 위해 쥐를 사냥한다고 생각해 보세요

translation.en: cooking and hanging them to eat the next day.
translation.ko: 다음 날 먹기 위해 쥐를 굽고 매달아 놓은 모습 말입니다

translation.en: With crops ruined and no money to buy meat,
translation.ko: 농작물이 망가지고 고기를 살 돈이 없게 되자

translation.en: these are the means they must resort to, to survive.
translation.ko: 굶지 않기 위해 이렇게까지 하는 것입니다

translation.en: It is not only where you live that can be dangerous,
translation.ko: 어디에 사는지가 꼭 위험 요소는 아닙니다

translation.en: sometimes it's about the daily commute from one place to the next.
translation.ko: 매일 하는 통근 자체가 위험할 수도 있습니다

translation.en: When you call the northern reaches of Pakistan home,
getting around is a tricky prospect.
translation.ko: 집에 가는 길이 꽤 험할 것 같습니다

translation.en: This is a mountain country.
In fact, you'll find four of the world's 14 mountains
that exceed 8,000 meters around these parts.
Driving here requires patience, skill and nerves of steel.
translation.ko: 여기에서 운전하려면 인내심, 실력 강인한 정신력이 필요합니다

translation.en: It's very dangerous.
It's dangerous because it's very narrow.
It's very bad surface.
The traffic is horrendous. There is a lot of trucks.
translation.ko: 도로 상황은 최악이고 트럭도 많이 다녀요

translation.en: And I was sitting on the bus thinking, "Okay, I'm not looking left or right."
translation.ko: 버스 안에서 절대 밖을 보지 말자고 생각했었죠

translation.en: We traveled through hanging bridges.
Can you imagine the bus, a four wheel drive,
traveling through the bridge which is constantly moving?
translation.ko: 흔들리는 다리를 건너는 걸 상상하실 수 있으세요?

translation.en: And it's not-- It doesn't look like it's very solid.
Your stomach turns upside down when you go through those things.
translation.ko: 그 다리를 건널 때면 속이 뒤집히는 것 같죠

translation.en: [narrator] For locals of the towns of Skardu and Gilgit,
a road trip to the Pakistani capital Islamabad
means taking one route only: the Karakoram Highway.
[Watroba] The local people living in Skardu
are a very nice community of, you know, farmers.
They've got schools. They've got the military hospital there.
But every time they have to go to Islamabad, the capital city,
translation.ko: 하지만 수도인 이슬라마바드에 가야 할 일이

translation.en: for different reasons, they have to make the journey.
That's the only road you can go.
We are on our way!
[narrator] Mountain climber Margaret Watroba traveled the highway
translation.ko: 마가렛 와트로바 등산가는 이 도로를 이용해

translation.en: en route to an expedition to the world's second highest peak, K2.
translation.ko: 세계에서 두 번째로 높은 K2로 갔습니다

translation.en: It's one journey she will never forget.
translation.ko: 절대 잊을 수 없는 여정일 겁니다

translation.en: [Watroba] When the car comes towards you
very often one of the cars has to back off to find a place to hide,
translation.ko: 때때로 양쪽 차 중에서 한 차가 후진해서

translation.en: so other car can pass you.
translation.ko: 상대 차가 지나갈 수 있게 해 주죠

translation.en: And the steepness from the road towards the river is incredible
and we were traveling like, centimeters from the edge.
translation.ko: 차는 도로 가장자리에 거의 붙어서 달리죠

translation.en: There are no barriers, no solid barriers.
[narrator] Built through the 1960s and '70s,
the construction of Karakoram Highway was a collaboration
between the Pakistani and Chinese governments
translation.ko: 파키스탄과 중국 정부가 협력해 지은 것으로

translation.en: linking Islamabad with Kashgar, 1,300 kilometers to the north in China.
translation.ko: 이슬라마바드에서 1,300km 떨어진 중국 북부 카슈가르까지 이어집니다

translation.en: Over a thousand workers died during the construction of the highway
translation.ko: 이 도로를 건설하면서 수천 명이 목숨을 잃었습니다

translation.en: and even today, sections of this road that cling to the steep mountainsides
and perch above fast-flowing rivers remain treacherous.
translation.ko: 길 아래로 흐르는 빠른 물살이 공포 분위기를 만들어 냅니다

translation.en: There are continuous landslides, bad roads, you know.
We had to wait two hours on our way back from Skardu to Islamabad
for the road to be repaired.
And people repair it by hand.
And I walk through the repaired part, the patch,
it was just moving up and down so I didn't go.
I didn't jump on the bus.
I was watching my bus going through.
It went through but I don't know how long that road would hold.
translation.ko: 버스는 지나갔지만 길이 얼마나 더 버틸진 모르겠네요

translation.en: [narrator] Like the ancient Silk Road trade route it retraces,
the Karakoram Highway remains a vital link between Pakistan's capital
and the communities of the northern mountain ranges.
translation.ko: 산맥의 북부 지역을 잇는 중요한 도로입니다

translation.en: A road not without risk,
but where courtesy, awareness and careful driving go a long away
towards rewarding travelers with safe passage.
translation.ko: 여행자도 보람차게 안전한 여행을 즐길 수 있습니다

translation.en: Traveling extreme roads is insanely hair-raising to the uninitiated,
translation.ko: 위험한 길로 여행하는 게 머리가 서는 듯 미친 것 같다면

translation.en: floating the canals of Venice is possibly far more relaxed.
translation.ko: 베니스 운하에 떠 있는 게 훨씬 안전하게 느껴질 것입니다

translation.en: However, this isn't a town
where you'd wanna live on the ground floor.
Venice, Italy's breathtaking city of canals on the Adriatic coast,
translation.ko: 이탈리아의 숨 막히게 아름다운 아드리아 해 연안 운하의 도시인

translation.en: a network of 118 islands connected by bridges,
all appearing to float on the surface of the Venetian Lagoon.
But this picturesque illusion could become a disappearing act.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 그림 같은 모습이 조만간 사라질지도 모릅니다

translation.en: All this water, tidal movement, weather events
translation.ko: 물, 조수의 움직임 기후 현상뿐 아니라

translation.en: and a city built on marshland,
this is a recipe for disaster that has all the right ingredients.
Whether it be extreme Adriatic tides or winter rains
translation.ko: 아드리아 해의 극심한 조수 차나 겨울비 때문에

translation.en: filling the rivers that flow down to the city,
Venice has always been prone to flooding.
It's a reality that locals are used to living with.
But even without rising waters,
Venetians will eventually get their feet wet no matter what time of year.
translation.ko: 베니스는 결국 물에 잠기게 될 것입니다

translation.en: You see, this is a city that is slowly but surely sinking.
translation.ko: 보다시피 베니스는 천천히 하지만 실제로 가라앉고 있습니다

translation.en: The drawing of groundwater from aquifers around the lagoon last century
translation.ko: 지난 세기의 석호 주변 대수층 지하수 도면이

translation.en: triggered this phenomenon.
But since the banning of artesian wells in 1960,
the sinking has slowed down.
Even a couple of millimeters each year, though,
is enough to ring the alarm bells.
It's hoped a barrier being constructed that can be raised to block the lagoon
translation.ko: 필요에 따라 건설 중인 장벽을 세워 석호를 막아

translation.en: when needed and protect Venice from the Adriatic's three meter tidal swells
translation.ko: 3m 높이의 아드리아 해의 조수 차로부터 베니스를

translation.en: will earn it a reprieve in the short term.
translation.ko: 일시적으로나마 보호해 줄 것을 기대해 봅니다

translation.en: But will it be enough to stop the floating city
translation.ko: 하지만 물 위에 떠 있는 이 도시가

translation.en: eventually sinking into oblivion?
From Venice, we head to number 47.
But don't let the ranking fool you.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 순위에 속으면 안 됩니다

translation.en: This is a place to visit with extreme caution...
translation.ko: 여길 방문할 때는 극도의 주의가 필요합니다

translation.en: if you're allowed in at all.
It all started with one single case. That's all it takes to start an epidemic.
Wild animal meets boy. Boy meets family.
translation.ko: 야생 동물과 접촉한 소년이 가족과 접촉하고

translation.en: Family meets community.
And it spreads like wildfire,
especially in a country that has limited medical facilities,
lack of water and sanitation.
After rural Guinea,
Ebola quickly delivered many tragic surprises
translation.ko: 빠르게 번진 에볼라는 끔찍한 결과를 가져옵니다

translation.en: to unsuspecting victims across its capital Conakry
and it's bordering Sierra Leone and Liberia.
More than two and a half thousand in Guinea alone
lost their lives, with unexpected flare-ups still happening.
Ebola's spread can be controlled by strict infection-control practices,
translation.ko: 엄격한 감염 관리로 에볼라를 통제할 수는 있지만

translation.en: but there is no cure for the hemorrhagic disease.
Living dangerously in Guinea is real.
Ebola doesn't disappear. It just goes into hiding.
translation.ko: 에볼라는 사라진 게 아니라 단지 숨은 것뿐입니다

translation.en: Curbing community resistance to control measures
and changing behaviors while rebuilding a broken community
translation.ko: 폐허가 된 마을을 재건하면서 행동 양식을 바꾸는 것이

translation.en: is what it will take to wear the crown in the fight against Ebola.
There's no safety in complacency
when you're face to face with this disease.
The danger of disease is widespread, but not all diseases are contagious.
translation.ko: 에볼라의 위험성이 널리 알려졌지만 모든 병이 전염되는 건 아닙니다

translation.en: The fallout of nuclear testing delivers debilitating consequences.
[man] There she goes.
Following the now familiar blinding flash, the sinister mushroom rises.
translation.ko: 눈부신 섬광에 이어 어두운 버섯 구름이 핍니다

translation.en: A successful test.
It became the most heavily contaminated place on Earth.
It's almost like they chose Maralinga and said,
"Here's the loveliest country on Earth and we're gonna blow it out of existence."
translation.ko: 지구에서 가장 사랑스러우니 폭파해야겠다고 한 것 같아요

translation.en: And they did.
[narrator] Between 1956 and 1963,
the British government, in conjunction with the Australian government,
set up a nuclear testing site about an eight to ten-hour drive
translation.ko: 사우스오스트레일리아 주 애들레이드 북서쪽 미답의 장소에

translation.en: through largely untouched landscape, northwest of Adelaide in South Australia.
translation.ko: 차로 8시간에서 10시간 들어간 곳에 핵 실험지를 마련했습니다

translation.en: There was huge activity going on there.
British scientists, the three armed services from Australia:
army, navy and air force, the same with the British army, navy and air force.
translation.ko: 호주 육군, 해군, 공군 영국 육군, 해군, 공군이 있었어요

translation.en: [narrator] The area, known as Maralinga, was deemed isolated enough
for a vast array of nuclear tests.
translation.ko: 다수의 핵 실험을 하기에 적합한 지역이었습니다

translation.en: Seven atomic bombs were exploded as part of Operation Buffalo
and Operation Antler in 1956 and '57.
The experiments were to test the effect of an atomic explosion
on military equipment in preparation for the event of a nuclear war.
Avon Hudson was in the Australian Air Force
and after gaining security clearance
from the Australian Security Intelligence Organization,
arrived at Maralinga in 1960 with little clue as to what was going on.
translation.ko: 무슨 일인지도 모른 채 1960년 마랄링가에 도착했습니다

translation.en: [Hudson] What I didn't know
was there still was a very big active program going on.
So when I arrived there it was a bit of a surprise
because I didn't expect to be in the thick of everything.
translation.ko: 한창 진행 중일 거라곤 생각 못 했거든요

translation.en: Because a few of my mates said,
"Oh, you'll have a bludge up there, there's really nothing to do."
translation.ko: 거기엔 할 게 아무것도 없으니 편하게 있으면 된다고 했는데

translation.en: Well, it wasn't.
I was there for a while.
And like all high security areas,
you get moved on, so you don't see everything.
That's typical of what happens
in many of these types of top security areas.
But what I witnessed and what I was involved in
was a bit horrifying.
[narrator] Fifty years since his service at Maralinga,
Avon is still sharing his stories, fighting for what he believes,
translation.ko: 에이번 씨는 그때 이야기를 하며 믿음을 위해 투쟁하고 있습니다

translation.en: wanting everyone to know that the fallout from this era
translation.ko: 그 당시 실험 때문에 낙진이 흩어져 호주 전역에 많은 영향을 끼친 걸

translation.en: registered widely across Australia that many were affected.
Well, I had several mates there...
They're both dead now.
They were there in '56
when the actual first bombs were exploded there.
[narrator] All personnel had to be six miles away from the explosion site
translation.ko: 모든 사람은 폭파지에서 약 10km 떨어져 있어야 했고

translation.en: and were told to turn their backs to the explosion.
translation.ko: 폭파 현장으로부터 등을 지고 있도록 명령받았습니다

translation.en: It was like somebody run a heater
translation.ko: 마치 누가 난방기를 켠 것 같았대요

translation.en: over his back.
And he had to flinch from the heat from the blasts.
translation.ko: 그 열기랑 폭발 때문에 몸이 움찔했고요

translation.en: [man] The mighty power of the atom is unleashed!
[Hudson] And then they had to put their hands over their eyes
translation.ko: 그리고 손으로 눈을 가려야 했다고 하더군요

translation.en: to make sure the flash never affected them 'cause it can blind you.
translation.ko: 불빛에 눈이 멀지 않도록 그렇게 시킨 거죠

translation.en: But he could see all his finger bones through his eyes.
The flash came right through him like an X-ray.
And then, about ten seconds later...
the sound came.
Much later, the shock wave hit him.
And nearly knocked him over.
[narrator] Whilst the tests ranged in size from 1.4 kilotons to 26.6 kilotons
the last of the seven explosions, code named Taranaki, was the largest,
translation.ko: 최종 실험인 코드명 타라나키의 폭파 규모가 가장 컸습니다

translation.en: larger than the atomic bombs that hit Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945
translation.ko: 세계 2차 대전 말인 1945년 히로시마와 나가사키에 떨어진

translation.en: at the end of World War II.
[Hudson] Because they were experimental bombs, in testing phase,
they were very dirty, radiologically.
So the radiation done huge damage as well.
[narrator] For the local Aboriginal families,
their home had become the atomic test site.
translation.ko: 자신이 살던 집이 핵폭탄 실험지가 된 것입니다

translation.en: Most of the indigenous people living in the area
had been moved on by authorities.
But many did not avoid the radioactive fallout.
There was no place that I know of
where you're reading all the literature around the world,
from various sources, that had so much plutonium in such one area.
translation.ko: 플루토늄이 이렇게 많이 검출된 곳이 없더군요

translation.en: We know plutonium is highly dangerous.
translation.ko: 플루토늄이 굉장히 위험한 건 모두가 알고 있죠

translation.en: It's one of those long-lived, not the longest lived isotope.
translation.ko: 가장 길진 않지만 생명력이 긴 동위 원소예요

translation.en: It is one of the long-lived, highly dangerous ones.
[narrator] The clean-up operation over the years has been extensive.
translation.ko: 대규모 제거 작업이 몇 년간 계속됐지만

translation.en: However, there is still much debate about how safe the area is.
translation.ko: 이 지역이 안전한지는 여전히 논란이 있습니다

translation.en: [Hudson] Well, they cleaned up the immediate area,
translation.ko: 직접 연관이 있는 곳은 낙진 제거 작업을 했어요

translation.en: where the actual contamination, the blasts took place.
I could go back there now and I'd feel quite safe,
translation.ko: 지금 당장 거기 가도 안전하다고 느낄 거예요

translation.en: because they took off up to a meter of earth.
In some places more than a meter,
and took it away and buried it in a deep trench.
But for the first 90 miles, it's still quite heavily contaminated
translation.ko: 하지만 첫 145km 정도는 여전히 오염돼 있어요

translation.en: with plutonium just laying on the surface.
And that can still blow away under adverse weather conditions,
translation.ko: 기후 조건이 나빠지면 여전히 폭발 가능성이 있어요

translation.en: so realistically, it was a huge amount in an area
translation.ko: 현실적으로 한 지역에 너무 많은 양이 있었던 거죠

translation.en: that lasts to this day and will for another 240,000 years.
translation.ko: 그래서 아직도 남아 있고 240,000년 더 남아 있을 거예요

translation.en: [narrator] The Australian government, declaring the site safe,
translation.ko: 호주 정부에서는 이 지역이 안전하다고 주장하면서

translation.en: has returned the land to the traditional owners
who are setting up the former nuclear test site as a tourism center.
translation.ko: 과거 핵 실험지를 다시 만들어 관광지화 하고 있죠

translation.en: It's an opportunity to maintain the history
of what happened in these lands.
There are still warning signs
and there are many who would never step foot near Maralinga.

translation.en: We are ranking the 72 most dangerous places to live

In the foreseeable future
